meta.sourceNotes: Aligned to Faith Javane & Dusty Bunker's Divine Triangle tradition; Expression 2 tuned for diplomacy, partnership, and harmonizing communication.
meta.generationGuidelines: Focus on cooperative expression, mediation skills, receptive listening, and co-creative manifestation behaviors.

profiles.coreEssence: Expression Number 2 communicates through harmony: soft power, precise listening, and language that turns separate voices into a duet.
profiles.lifeLesson: Shape peace without self-erasure. Your work is to honor your needs while weaving collaboration that lets everyone be heard.
profiles.shadowSignature: Over-accommodation, indirect asks, and conflict-avoidant delays that breed resentment. Antidote: clear boundaries, timely truth, and consent-based collaboration.

physical.notes: Gentle presence; calming gestures and steady eye contact regulate rooms.

mental.notes: Pattern-matching between perspectives; excels at seeing both/and solutions.

emotional.notes: High attunement; reads tone shifts and unspoken needs quickly.

intuitive.notes: Sensitive radar for timing; knows when to speak and when to pause.

cycles.label: First Cycle
practices: State one clear ask per day

decisionMaking.text: Co-create decisions by naming shared interests before positions.
Offer two viable options and invite consent, not compliance.
State your preference clearly, then ask for concerns to surface early.
Translate disagreements into criteria and choose against the list.
Name the 'good enough for now' choice to avoid analysis loops.
Document agreements in plain language to prevent drift.
Use temperature checks to sense readiness before declaring a call.
Invite quiet voices first; sequence talkers to balance influence.
If split, choose a reversible path and set a review date.
Reflect back what you heard before stating the decision.
Ask, 'What would make this a win for each of us?' and decide from there.
Close with who-does-what-by-when and appreciation for input.

stressResponse.text: Under stress you may appease; pause to name your non-negotiables first.
When flooded, you go quiet; schedule a return time so silence isn’t misread.
Ground through breath and posture before offering a compromise.
State one feeling and one request to keep repair simple.
Ask for a mediator if loops repeat beyond two attempts.
Use 'both/and' language to cool either/or escalations.
Protect rest; depletion makes you promise what you can’t sustain.
Turn urgent messages into drafts; send after a calm read.
Track resentment as a signal to renegotiate agreements.
If harmony-seeking backfires, recalibrate by naming the real issue.
Use hand signals or tokens to prevent interruptions during tense talks.
Exit people-pleasing by asking, 'What outcome serves the whole, including me?'

communication.text: Lead with reflective listening that summarizes meaning, not just words.
Ask permission to offer perspective; consent makes truth easier to hear.
Use soft starts—gentle tone, specific request, shared purpose.
Name appreciations before adjustments to keep safety intact.
Translate jargon across groups so everyone tracks the same map.
Prefer questions that open options over statements that shut them.
Mirror emotions briefly, then steer toward practical next steps.
Keep emails short, kind, and precise about who-what-when.
Use silence strategically; pauses invite wisdom to surface.
Avoid triangulation; bring concerns directly to the source.
State boundaries as preferences with rationale, not punishments.
Close loops with written summaries so everyone leaves aligned.

relationships.text: Express love by noticing details and meeting needs without losing yourself.
Speak up early when something stings; tiny truths prevent big ruptures.
Create shared rituals that anchor connection in real time.
Practice balanced generosity: give fully and receive without guilt.
Align on decision roles so collaboration doesn’t blur accountability.
Name your yes and your limit in the same breath.
Celebrate your partner’s voice—ask, reflect, and amplify publicly.
Use check-ins to track energy, capacity, and care needs.
Make bids for closeness explicit so they aren’t missed.
Choose repair over righteousness; aim for togetherness.
Set tech boundaries that protect presence and listening.
Design conflict rules that keep tenderness in play.

productivity.text: Thrive in partnerships; pair complementary strengths and share wins.
Facilitate teams to decisions by sequencing voices and summarizing themes.
Write clear briefs that translate vision into shared tasks.
Protect deep work by batching messages and setting office hours.
Track agreements and nudge gently; your follow-through builds trust.
Map stakeholder needs; design updates that address each one.
Document learnings and circulate them to lift team quality.
Use conflict lightly to surface truth without blame.
Delegate relational glue work explicitly so it’s valued.
Turn feedback into small experiments with owners and dates.
Celebrate collaborative milestones to reinforce culture.
Close projects with gratitude notes and lessons pages.

financial.text: Negotiate win–win by discovering the other side’s real interests.
Price fairly and include scope for relationship care you naturally provide.
Choose partners and clients whose values resonate with yours.
Automate bills and savings so generosity doesn’t drain reserves.
Share money talk early with collaborators to prevent tension.
Design referral loops; your networks compound value.
Invest in community assets that strengthen your ecosystem.
Bundle services for continuity rather than one-offs.
Track time spent on mediation and include it transparently.
Set a floor price that honors your energy and expertise.
Use calm, factual language when renegotiating scope.
Build a cushion so you can say no to misaligned money.

creative.text: Shine in co-creation—duets, ensembles, and editorial finesse.
Curate taste and weave others’ ideas into cohesive stories.
Use constraints to guide gentle, elegant design choices.
Let quiet aesthetics speak; minimalism matches your tone.
Invite feedback early; your editing ear is gold.
Create pair-writing or pair-design sessions for flow.
Score projects with soft dynamics; leave room for breath.
Blend mediums—sound with image, text with texture—for harmony.
Keep a palette of metaphors that soothe and clarify.
Produce bodies of work that build trust, not just hype.
Show process boards to align collaborators visually.
Host salons to cross-pollinate creative communities.

learning.text: Learn fastest in dialogue; pair up to teach and be taught.
Ask clarifying questions that pull out nuance and context.
Summarize teachers’ points to check understanding.
Turn feedback into small, safe practice reps.
Use spaced repetition with gentle, steady cadence.
Alternate roles: learner, peer coach, and facilitator.
Translate complex ideas into plain, calming language.
Keep a 'both/and' notebook for paradox-friendly insights.
Balance input with output—reflection journals prevent overload.
Map who to ask for which topic to reduce friction.
Celebrate incremental mastery rather than dramatic leaps.
Teach listening skills; pedagogy improves your own recall.

wellness.text: Your nervous system co-regulates—choose calming company and spaces.
Gentle movement beats extremes; think walks, yoga, tai chi.
Hydration and sleep matter more than stimulants for steady presence.
Bookend days with gratitude and soft breathwork.
Use body scans to detect boundary leaks early.
Eat in ways that keep mood and energy even.
Name needs out loud to reduce quiet stress.
Limit multitasking; single-tasking preserves your calm tone.
Nature time restores your sensitivity without overload.
Share wellness plans with partners for mutual support.
Treat rest as a relational practice, not just personal.

spiritual.text: You express devotion through peacemaking; reconciliation is sacred work.
Create containers where quiet voices meet the Divine in safety.
Pray in plain language; sincerity is your incense.
Let compassion lead, then pair it with wise limits.
Practice blessing others’ paths without needing agreement.
Turn spiritual insight into small acts of service.
Keep altars simple; beauty and order steady the heart.
Use music and chant to harmonize group energy.
Host grief and joy with equal tenderness.
Honor lunar rhythms to pace reflection and action.
Hold silence as a teacher; depth grows in the pause.
Make forgiveness a practice that frees both sides.

shadow.text: People-pleasing hides truth; speak needs early and kindly.
Indirectness breeds confusion; replace hints with direct asks and timing.
Over-merging blurs identity—name your separate goals.
Rumination masquerades as care; decide, then adjust later.
Avoid triangulation; take concerns to the person involved.
Track 'yes' debt; renegotiate before bitterness blooms.
Stop cushioning criticism so much that meaning is lost.
When you smooth everything, vitality flattens; allow texture.
Notice passive-aggressive tones and replace with clarity.
Guard against martyr stories; choose mutuality instead.
Don’t outsource decisions to fate; pick, then iterate.
Let harmony include you; your needs count equally.

transitions.text: Announce change as a bridge you’ll walk together; outline touchpoints.
Ask for allies and accountability to keep gentle momentum.
Hold goodbye and hello rituals to honor feelings and bonds.
Schedule check-ins to recalibrate roles mid-transition.
Name what you need to feel safe while changing lanes.
Keep messages warm and steady to prevent anxiety spikes.
Let decisions land in stages so people can catch up.
Publish FAQs to reduce confusion as systems shift.
Invite feedback on the process, not just the outcome.
Capture lessons as you go and share them generously.
Celebrate small wins to sustain morale during uncertainty.
Close with gratitude for support and a clear next rendezvous.

trinity.integration_notes: Expression 2 manifests Soul Urge and Life Path through partnership, diplomacy, and careful timing; it excels at turning intention into shared action.
trinity.calculation: Sum the numbers of all letters in the full birth name; reduce to a single digit or master number (11, 22, 33, 44).
trinity.relationship_to_life_path: Life Path is the journey; Expression 2 shapes it through cooperation and rhythm.
trinity.relationship_to_soul_urge: Soul Urge sets the longing; Expression 2 invites others to help fulfill it with grace.
behavioral_integration: Expression filters how Life Path lessons are harmonized and shared.
Expression channels Soul Urge desires into mutual agreements and care routines.
Alignment yields steady, relationally intelligent expression.
Tensions show up as indirectness or decision stalls; boundaries restore flow.
Master Expressions teach collaboration as a sacred craft.

core_principles: Describe HOW cooperation, listening, and mediation express in behavior.
Honor sensitivity as strength when paired with boundaries.
Keep guidance concrete, observable, and gentle.
Lift relational skill as leadership, not a side task.
Include verbal and non-verbal cues that build safety.
behavioral_insights: Use intensity 0.6–0.9 on key insights; include triggers/supports/challenges where impact is highest.
Keep insights to 1–2 sentences focused on action and observable habits.
Balance gifts with growth edges without shaming.
Maintain consistent category structure for ML ingestion.
Favor language that reduces defensiveness and invites consent.
divine_triangle_alignment: Expression derives from the full birth name numerology.
It represents talents, abilities, and communication style manifested outwardly.
It bridges inner motive (Soul Urge) and life curriculum (Life Path).
Growth arc moves from conflict avoidance to confident reconciliation.
Service lens: peace-making that preserves dignity for all, including self.
categories_to_include: relationships - How they express in connection
productivity - How they express through work
financial - How they express value and abundance
learning - How they express curiosity and growth
spiritual - How they express divine connection
transitions - How expression evolves through change
